scheduler

Class TimeTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduler.TimeTable

  • public class TimeTable
extends java.lang.Object
    A class consisting of timeslots that always have a start- and end moment. The slots stored here represent timeslots from real life.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.util.Comparator<TimeSlot> c
      This will allow us to keep the TimeSlots chronologically sorted.
      private java.util.LinkedList<TimeSlot> timeSlots

        public TimeTable getAllFreeSlots(long length)
                          throws InvalidSchedulingRequestException,
                                 InvalidTimeSlotException

        Parameters:

        time - The point in time from which to start looking from.
        Returns:
        A TimeTable that contains all free slots of this TimeTable.

      • hasFreeSlotAt

        public boolean hasFreeSlotAt(TimeSlot slotToCheck)
        This method will check whether or not this TimeTable has a free slot at the given parameter slot.
        Parameters:
        slotToCheck - The TimeSlot to be checked for.
        Returns:
        True if this TimeTable is free for the complete given TimeSlot.

      • isBackToBack

        public boolean isBackToBack(HospitalDate startDate)

      • getUnion

        public TimeTable getUnion(TimeTable that)
                   throws InvalidTimeSlotException
        The union of 2 timetables is this, the union of time slots, Ex : union {(1,9),(21,55)} with {(3,15)} is {(1,15),(21,55)} Thus where both Timetables are occupied.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        InvalidTimeSlotException

      • getIntersect

        public TimeTable getIntersect(TimeTable that)
                       throws InvalidTimeSlotException,
                              InvalidSchedulingRequestException
        This function will calculate the intersection of this timetable with another timetable. The result is a new timetable that is marked as "busy" when both timetables are busy.
        Parameters:
        that - The timetable which has to be intersected with this one.
        Returns:
        A new timetable that has all the busy-slots of both timetables.
        Throws:
        InvalidTimeSlotException
        InvalidSchedulingRequestException

      • eliminateOverlap

        public void eliminateOverlap()
        This function will eliminate all overlap in a given timetable. Also all things that are scheduled back to back will be considered as a whole thing. E.g. A timetable with timeslots from 1 to 9 and from 5 to 13, will return the timepoints 1 (start) and 13 (stop). E.g. A timetable with timeslots from 1 to 5 and from 5 to 9, will return the timepoints 1 (start) and 9 (stop).
        Parameters:
        timeTable - A certain timetable that has to be simplified

      • getTimePoints

        public TimePoint[] getTimePoints()

      • intersectAll

        public static TimeTable intersectAll(java.util.Collection<TimeTable> tables)
                              throws InvalidTimeSlotException,
                                     InvalidSchedulingRequestException
        This method will get the intersection of this TimeTable with a lot of other TimeTables.
        Parameters:
        tables - The collection of Tables you would like to get the intersection with.
        Returns:
        A TimeTable that's the intersection of all given tables and this table.
        Throws:
        InvalidTimeSlotException
        InvalidSchedulingRequestException

      • equals

        public boolean equals(TimeTable t)
        Returns:
